title.rendered: Find Rooms For Rent In Jerome Park

content.rendered:
Jerome Park, an area in the Bronx, was named after the Jerome Park Racetrack that existed here in the 1800s. Leonard Jerome, who built the racetrack, was a wealthy Brooklyn citizen and a successful stock speculator on Wall Street. Jerome Park is now home to the Bronx High School of Science, Lehman College, and lots of green spaces. Considering the area as a place to move to? This guide tells you everything you need to know about the average rent in Jerome Park, restaurants in Jerome Park, and rooms for rent in Jerome Park.

Related: Uber or Taxi in NYC: Which is Better?

Where is Jerome Park?

Jerome Park is located in New York City’s North Bronx region, just east of the Hudson River. It belongs to the “Annexed District,” a group of neighborhoods that were moved over to Bronx County in 1874. Jerome Park includes the Van Cortlandt Village, the Kingsbridge Heights Village, and Norwood. The Jerome Park Reservoir in Jerome Park was emptied in 2008 to make way for the construction of the Croton Water Filtration Plant.

Find Rooms For Rent in Jerome Park

Find Rooms For Rent In Jerome Park

Jerome Park is home to duplexes, single-family homes, and apartment complexes. 80% of the residential buildings in Jerome Park are occupied by renters. Furthermore, most of the structures in the area are pre-war courtyard buildings that provide generous square footage for renters.

Average Rent in Jerome Park

The average rent in Jerome Park is $1,700 per month. Students can find affordable rental options in Jerome Park as it is home to the Lehman College School of Continuing and Professional Studies. Plus, Fordham University isn’t far away. Please note, though, that the cost of rooms for rent in Jerome Park will vary depending on the number of bedrooms.

Is Jerome Park safe?

Naturally, as you look for rooms for rent in Jerome Park, you will want to make sure the neighborhood you’re moving to is safe and secure. Below are some helpful tools, so you can learn more about the specific Jerome Park neighborhood you’re eyeing. These will make it easier for you to make plans and navigate your way around Jerome Park.

  • AreaVibes: AreaVibes generates a livability score based on a one-of-a-kind algorithm that takes into account a specific location’s qualities. These include data such as its amenities, cost of living, employment rate, safety rate, and schools in the area, among other factors.
  • AroundMe: AroundMe is an app that lets you look for the nearest bank, gas station, hotel, or restaurant. It’s a navigation tool that allows you to easily search for relevant establishments in the area.
  • Niche: Niche helps connect people to neighborhoods and workplaces. It also has a profile on each college and school in the U.S., making it a go-to resource for families and students.
  • Hotline Numbers: If you feel you are in danger, call 911 or the local emergency number immediately. Some examples of emergencies are a car crash, a crime, a fire, or a medical emergency. For non-emergencies, such as complaints, reporting graffiti or road damage, or simply making an inquiry about a service, call 311.

Public Transit in Jerome Park

Walkability

Apart from there being affordable rooms for rent in Jerome Park, it’s great to know that Jerome Park neighborhoods are among the most walkable in New York City. With an average Walk Score of 93, this means you can easily perform daily errands on foot.

Roads & Traffic

According to the New York State Department of Transportation, Bronx County is home to 10 regional highways. The Bronx has the third-highest population density in New York City, so you’re advised to take public transportation where possible.

Nearby Train Stations

Two of New York City’s subway systems pass through the Bronx: the Interborough Rapid Transit Company (IRT), and the Independent Subway System (IND). The closest transit lines to Jerome Park are the MTA Subway’s 1, 4, and D routes. Rooms for rent in Jerome Park are a sure winner if they’re near a train station.

Nearby Bus Stops

The Bronx is serviced by a vast network of local and limited services as well as express routes. The BX3, BXM3, and BXM4 bus routes pass near Jerome Park. You can find out the nearest bus stop by checking out the Bronx bus routes on the Metropolitan Transportation Authority website.

Restaurants in Jerome Park

While you’re settling in, don’t forget to explore restaurants in Jerome Park. Make sure you check out these places that will surely hit the spot!

Nicky’s Coffee Shop

Nicky’s Coffee Shop is a diner run by a Greek family. It serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Customers swear by their chicken gyro, burgers, and waffles.

Website

Com Tam Ninh Kieu

Com Tam Ninh Kieu is a Vietnamese restaurant that offers specialties such as noodle soup, Vietnamese sandwiches, fresh spring rolls, and more. You can also order takeaway or have their food delivered to your apartment.

Website

Estrellita Poblana

Estrellita Poblana is a Mexican restaurant in the Bronx’s Little Italy. Make sure you try their bestsellers: quesadillas, burritos, and tacos.

Website

Parks near Jerome Park

As you look for rooms for rent in Jerome Park, you might also want to take a look at parks in the area. They’re great places to relax, breathe in the fresh air, and enjoy the outdoors.

  • Van Cortlandt Park: The largest park in Northwest Bronx, here parkgoers can enjoy the shade of its oak trees, outdoor paths, and playing fields.
  • Fort Independence Playground: Apart from being pet-friendly and having basketball courts, this playground/park lets kids enjoy spray showers, too.
  • Harris Park: This park includes baseball, football, and soccer fields, as well as a whole host of excellent eateries.

Museums near Jerome Park

1. The Fordham Museum of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Art

This museum, located inside Fordham University, spans 4,000 square feet. Check out its collection of over 200 objects dating back to the 4th millennium B.C.

2. Van Cortlandt House Museum

Tour the Van Cortlandt House, the oldest building in the Bronx. It is said that August Van Cortlandt played a role during the Revolutionary War, when New York was under British occupation.

3. The Museum of Bronx History

Learn about the Valentine-Varian House, which was restored and opened as the Museum of Bronx History. The Valentine home was occupied by American, British, and Hessian troops during the Revolutionary War.

We hope this guide gives you everything you need to know before settling in Jerome Park. Happy moving and good luck!
